Name: JAKE
Text: This job is eating me alive. I can't breathe anymore.

Name: JAKE
Text: I spent all these years trying to be the good guy, the man in the white hat. I'm not becoming like them... I am them.

Name: AMY
Text: What are you doing, weirdo?

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm doing the best speech from "Donnie Brasco." Actually-- --ten of me are doing the best speech from Donnie Brasco. Sup?

Name: AMY
Text: Get it together, man. All ten of you.

Name: AMY
Text: Store was hit about two hours ago. Perps disabled the alarm

Name: JAKE
Text: Sorry! My bad.

Name: AMY
Text: I'd like a list of your employees, anyone who had access to the store. I'd also like to apologize for my partner. His parents didn't give him enough attention.

Name: JAKE
Text: DO YOU BELIEVE IN LIFE AFTER LOVE? --

Name: AMY
Text: Dude, seriously?

Name: JAKE
Text: I know, not my first choice either, but it's stuck. Got any other songs, Ahmed?

Name: AHMED
Text: No, is broken. You want it? One-fifty for you. Works perfect.

Name: JAKE
Text: You literally just said it was broken. (singing) I THINK THIS ROBB-RY WAS A SMASH AND GRAB I REALLY BELIEVE IT WAS A SMASH AND GRAB, OH!!!

Name: AMY
Text: Really, Cher? I think it was an inside job. Prove me wrong.

Name: JAKE
Text: A challenge? Is this a challenge? I love challenges! The door and the register were both forced, and they tripped a motion sensor -- i.e., not an inside job.

Name: AMY
Text: Or it's an inside job meant to look like a smash and grab.

Name: JAKE
Text: Sorry. We're looking for three white males, one of whom has tatt sleeves on both arms.

Name: AMY
Text: And how do you know that, dare I ask?

Name: JAKE
Text: I had a confidential informant on the inside. He spent years right here, in this sale bin, watching, learning, waiting. His code name is... (holds up teddy bear) Fuzzy Cuddle Bear! And he's a nanny cam.

Name: AMY
Text: Ugh. You got lucky.

Name: JAKE
Text: You know what they say: Luck is 95% talent, 5% being awesome.

Name: AMY
Text: No one's ever said that.

Name: JAKE
Text: (to the bear) Whelp... we did it, Fuzzy. We got 'em. You can come home now. (as the bear) "I don't know if I can. I've been undercover so long, I don't even know who I am anymore. I've done terrible things."

Name: AMY
Text: All right.

Name: JAKE
Text: (as Fuzzy, crying) "I strangled a Mr. Potato Head with my bare hands. Oh God, what have I become?!"

Name: TERRY
Text: All right. Let's get started.

Name: TERRY
Text: Quiet, please. Come on, guys, I don't want to have to raise my voice. Rosa?

Name: ROSA
Text: Shut up! Everyone shuts up.

Name: TERRY
Text: Thank you, Rosa. First off, Gina has some administrative announcements.

Name: GINA
Text: Thank you. Thank you. No need to applaud. First of all, starting today there's a new claim form for "lost equipment." Sadly, I have misplaced it.

Name: GINA
Text: But seriously, I do not know where I put those forms. If you see them, let me know. Also, my dance troupe, "Floor-gasm," is performing at the Atlantic Antic on Sunday. Please come watch me dance, unless you are an old pervert.

Name: TERRY
Text: Thank you, Gina. Open cases -- you closed the electronics store robbery from last week?

Name: JAKE
Text: Patrol picked up all three mopes yesterday, Sarge. Would you like to do the honor?

Name: AMY
Text: I hate this. I hate this. Enjoy it while it lasts.

Name: JAKE
Text: I will!

Name: TERRY
Text: JP, update on the Morgenthau murder?

Name: JAKE
Text: Early this morning, someone decided to shoot and kill luxury food importer Harry Morgenthau. Body was discovered by his cleaning lady. During her interview, using expert detective work, I deduced that she had something super gross on her chin. I took a picture of it, as evidence.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I think it was flan.

Name: JAKE
Text: Charles thinks it was flan. I think it was butterscotch pudding.

Name: ROSA
Text: Maybe it was just, like, that old person gunk. You know the way they're always covered in gunk? Oldies are gross.

Name: TERRY
Text: How about we focus on the murder, instead of the old person gunk?

Name: AMY
Text: Crime techs are at the scene now, we're heading back in a few minutes.

Name: TERRY
Text: I want the four of you on this -- it's gonna be priority one for new C.O.

Name: ROSA
Text: Tell us about this new captain. You worked with him before, right?

Name: TERRY
Text: Years ago. Captain Holt will be here soon. He'll want to introduce himself.

Name: AMY
Text: Well, as soon as he's settled in, I have a presentation for him. (pulls out folder) Crime-stat analysis for the precinct, and some strategy proposals.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, are you hoping to be put in charge of the Brown Noser Squad, Sergeant Asskisser?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yeah, then maybe one day you can be Lieutenant Asskisser, on the Brown Noser Squad.

Name: JAKE
Text: That's exactly what I said.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Great minds, right?

Name: TERRY
Text: Put the murder down, guys. Dismissed.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey Gina, you know any scalpers? I want to buy tickets for the Rihanna concert for me and Rosa, but they're sold out.

Name: GINA
Text: ...Okay, yeah, two points to make here. First: Rihanna? (gesturing vaguely to him) You... Rihanna.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yes. What's your second point?

Name: GINA
Text: That you're wasting your time. She's got a type, which is: anyone but you.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yeah, that was my ex-wife's type, too.

Name: GINA
Text: A Rihanna concert is a pretty big swing, man. She's into watching old movies. Maybe start there.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Cool. Where... would I find a place that shows old movies?

Name: GINA
Text: Just go on the internet and search for the phrase "I want to buy two movie tickets for a girl who doesn't like me."

Name: CHARLES
Text: ...I don't even need to add the zip code, or something?

Name: JAKE
Text: Just got these crime scene photos -- look at the victim's socks.

Name: AMY
Text: ...What? I don't see anything.

Name: JAKE
Text: No, just -- they're super nice socks, right? Where do you get socks like that? I have the worst socks.

Name: AMY
Text: Hey -- have you heard anything about the new captain?

Name: JAKE
Text: No, and I don't care. Terry runs the detective squad, and he's great.

Name: AMY
Text: Terry's an emotional wreck.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes, but he's our emotional wreck. I wish Captain McGintly had never left. He was the best.

Name: AMY
Text: He was terrible. You just liked him because he let you do anything you wanted.

Name: MCGINTLEY
Text: What the hell are you doing?

Name: JAKE
Text: Fire extinguisher roller chair derby.

Name: MCGINTLEY
Text: ...Okay.

Name: ROSA
Text: -- annnnnd go!

Name: AMY
Text: If I'm ever gonna make captain I need a good mentor. I need my rabbi.

Name: JAKE
Text: Sorry, dude. This new guy's gonna be a washed-up pencil pusher, who's forgotten how to be a cop, and is only concerned with -- -- following every rule in the Patrol Guide, meep morp robot captain engage.

Name: HOLT
Text: Is that what you think?

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey! You must be the new C.O. Detective Jake Peralta. Great to meet you.

Name: HOLT
Text: Don't let me interrupt. You were describing what kind of person I'm going to be. I'd like you to finish.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, lemme see... "washed-up pencil- pusher"... "forgotten how to be a cop"... I think I was done, actually.

Name: HOLT
Text: Okay. Now do the robot voice. The robot voice you were doing when you implied I'm a rule-following robot. I want to hear it again.

Name: JAKE
Text: ..."Meep morp... zeep... robot..."

Name: HOLT
Text: That's a terrible robot voice. And the next time I see you, I'd like you to be wearing a necktie.

Name: JAKE
Text: Our old captain didn't care if we wore ties.

Name: HOLT
Text: Well, your new captain does. And more importantly, he cares that you follow his direct orders. Everyone. I'm your new commanding officer, Captain Ray Holt.

Name: AMY
Text: Speech! Speech!

Name: HOLT
Text: That was my speech. Sergeant Jeffords, a word?

Name: AMY
Text: I love that guy.

Name: GINA
Text: Yeah, he's really suave. Anyone else get kind of a gay vibe?

Name: HOLT
Text: Sergeant. You were in the 18th with me. Though you were significantly...

Name: TERRY
Text: Fatter, sir. They called me Terry Titties. Because I had... large...

Name: HOLT
Text: Titties. Yes. I remember. I never liked that nickname. Though to be fair, it was accurate. Says here you're on administrative leave?

Name: TERRY
Text: A year ago, my wife and I had twin baby girls. Cagney and Lacey. Ever since, I've kind of... clenched up. Lost my edge. There was an incident.

Name: TERRY
Text: You go in first. I'm feeling jumpy.

Name: JAKE
Text: What? You always go in first. Look at you -- those biceps don't go in "second."

Name: JAKE
Text: I think he's dead.

Name: TERRY
Text: It's been a year, and I... haven't...

Name: HOLT
Text: Tell me about your detective squad.

Name: TERRY
Text: Scully, Hitchcock, and Daniels. They're pretty much worthless. But they make good coffee.

Name: HOLT
Text: Copy that.

Name: TERRY
Text: Now the good ones. Rosa Diaz: tough, smart, hard to read, and scary as hell.

Name: ROSA
Text: Tell me who has me for Secret Santa.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: No! That takes all the fun out of it.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: It's Scully. He got you a scarf. It's blue and ugly. I'll make him return it.

Name: TERRY
Text: Charles Boyle: he's a grinder. Not the most brilliant detective, but he works harder than anyone else. He's not physically... gifted.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Awww man! My muffin!

Name: CHARLES
Text: Ow! My head! My muffin and my head!

Name: TERRY
Text: Amy Santiago: first girl cop in a family of cops. Gets underestimated because of her looks, so she's always trying to prove she's tough.

Name: AMY
Text: You think I can't handle this much hot sauce? I can handle way more than this.

Name: AMY
Text: In... your... face.

Name: SCULLY
Text: ...I didn't say anything.

Name: TERRY
Text: She and Peralta have some big bet over who gets more arrests this year. At first I objected, but ever since the bet, their numbers have gone way up.

Name: HOLT
Text: Tell me about Peralta.

Name: TERRY
Text: Jacob Peralta is my best detective -- he likes putting away bad guys and he loves solving puzzles. The only puzzle he hasn't solved... is how to grow up.

Name: HOLT
Text: That's very well put.

Name: TERRY
Text: I've talked a lot about Jake in my departmentally-mandated therapy sessions.

Name: HOLT
Text: They finally gave me my shot, Terry. You know my history -- you know how important this is to me. This precinct is doing fine. But I want to make it the best in Brooklyn. And I need your help.

Name: TERRY
Text: Absolutely, sir. Where do we start?

Name: HOLT
Text: We start with him.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. Perp came in through the window, left that muddy footprint, broke that cabinet -- hold on, hold on. Is everyone wearing a necktie? Because it's impossible to solve crimes if you're not wearing a tie.

Name: AMY
Text: Shell casings found here. ...Two shots. Bang... bang.

Name: JAKE
Text: I concur. Good work, detective. You get a tie.

Name: CHARLES
Text: That's mine. You took it out of my desk.

Name: JAKE
Text: That's right, Boyle. Good solve.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Thanks!

Name: AMY
Text: Shut up about Holt -- that man is going to be my rabbi.

Name: JAKE
Text: First of all, it's very weird to hear a Cuban woman refer to an African American man as her rabbi. Secondly, your "rabbi's" a pain in my ass.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yeah, he's a little too serious. What do you think, Rosa?

Name: ROSA
Text: Seems cool.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yeah, seems cool, I agree.

Name: ROSA
Text: Looks like the perp stole: a computer, a watch, and a jamon iberico ham, valued at... what?! Six thousand bucks?

Name: JAKE
Text: A ham for $6000? Is it from a talking pig? Is it made out of "Babe

Name: CHARLES
Text: Jamon iberico is an amazing cured ham from Spain. They had it at my uncle's funeral. I gorged myself at that funeral. I was constipated for three days. Rest in peace, Uncle Johnny.

Name: JAKE
Text: A murder and a ham heist? Things just got interesting. This is Captain Ray Holt. We're gonna need some extra ties.

Name: HOLT
Text: Speaking of ties, where's yours, Meep-Morp?

Name: JAKE
Text: You gotta be kidding me. Hi Captain! What are you doing here?

Name: HOLT
Text: I like to know what my detectives are up to. Take Santiago and knock on doors -- see if the neighbors heard anything.

Name: JAKE
Text: Door duty? It's a waste of time.

Name: HOLT
Text: Diaz and Boyle check in with the coroner. Report back to me in an hour.

Name: JAKE
Text: I think he's starting to like me!

Name: HOLT
Text: No, I'm not.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey, Rosa. I just happened to notice, there's an old movie festival at the Film Forum this week. You want to go?

Name: ROSA
Text: Sure.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Cool! Awesome. There's a bunch of movie options, so I'll send you those options, and you can pick an option and we will watch that option.

Name: ROSA
Text: You just pick.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yeah. I can definitely do that. I'll probably just go with something classic? Like "Citizen Kane."

Name: ROSA
Text: "Citizen Kane" is terrible. Pick a good movie.

Name: CHARLES
Text: It's every critic's favorite movie.

Name: JAKE
Text: Let the wasting of time begin.

Name: AMY
Text: As my grandpa used to say, "You gotta smell a lot of feet before you find the six-toed prince."

Name: JAKE
Text: What?

Name: AMY
Text: Cuba's a weird place. It means

Name: JAKE
Text: The reward is a six-toed prince?!

Name: AMY
Text: Hello, sir -- can we ask you a few questions?

Name: BUNDER
Text: Definitely. I'm actually super glad you guys are here. Are you smelling that weed smell? A dude just broke in here, smoked weed, and bolted.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, that checks out.

Name: AMY
Text: What is your name?

Name: BRJKOL
Text: My name Brjkolj. B-R-J-K-O-L-J.

Name: JAKE
Text: So, just like it sounds.

Name: AMY
Text: Have you ever seen this man before? He was shot last night.

Name: BRJKOL
Text: Thank you. Brjkolj like.

Name: AMY
Text: ...Sir? That's ours. We need that. And he kept it.

Name: JAKE
Text: Has anyone in the history of police work ever solved a crime by doing door duty?

Name: AMY
Text: First of all, yes. Many, many times. Secondly, my dad met my mom doing door duty in Queens.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I doubt you're going to meet thefuture Mr. Santiago in this hallway.

Name: AMY
Text: I don't know. Wall Street Journal on the doormat, corner apartment... Twenty bucks says this guy's like a hot banker.

Name: JAKE
Text: I'll take that action. Police, open up please.

Name: OLD MAN
Text: Hello?!

Name: JAKE
Text: Hello, sir! My name is Detective Right-All-The-Time, and this is my partner, Detective Terribledetective.

Name: AMY
Text: We were wondering if you heard anything unusual last night? And are you single?

Name: OLD MAN
Text: Yes. But I'm also dying.

Name: HOLT
Text: So Gina: in my experience, civilian administrators such as yourself often have their ear to the ground. What do Santiago and Peralta have riding on this bet of theirs?

Name: GINA
Text: I'll tell you, on six conditions. Number One: you let me use your office to practice m' dance moves. Second--

Name: HOLT
Text: How about this: if you tell me, I won't have you suspended without pay.

Name: GINA
Text: That sounds great. The bet is: if Amy gets more arrests, Jake has to give her his car. It's an old Mustang, pretty sweet. If he gets more arrests, she has to go on a date with him.

Name: HOLT
Text: Just one date?

Name: GINA
Text: He guarantees it'll end in sex. She says it won't. I don't know, though, Jake's got some moves. I'd bet on at least some over-the-clothes action.

Name: HOLT
Text: That's enough. Thank you, Gina.

Name: GINA
Text: I think you would get a real kick out of my jams.

Name: HOLT
Text: You cannot dance in my office.

Name: GINA
Text: Copy that.

Name: CHARLES
Text: No surprises from the coroner. Two gunshots, shoulder and chest.

Name: JAKE
Text: None of the neighbors heard or saw anything. And what's worse, Santiago struck out with a 90 year-old. Hard. It was embarrassing.

Name: HOLT
Text: All right. Hit the pawn shops. Canvas the neighborhood. And while you're out, you can buy yourself a tie.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, I'm wearing a tie right now. Check it out: Secret tie!

Name: HOLT
Text: First of all, you're kind of over-doing it on the man-scaping. But more importantly, why do you refuse to take my orders seriously, Detective?

Name: JAKE
Text: Because, sir, if you're wound too tight, you end up like Terry.

Name: TERRY
Text: Daddy's gonna be home soon. I love you. I just love you so much.

Name: JAKE
Text: Crying at your desk and playing with sock puppets.

Name: HOLT
Text: There's a middle ground, Detective. Does anyone here know why it's important to me that you dress appropriately? And it has nothing to do with the Patrol Guide.

Name: ROSA
Text: Guys look good in ties.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yes, they do! I'm wearing one right now!

Name: AMY
Text: Show respect for the job. Pride. Confidence? Happiness.

Name: JAKE
Text: Are we just naming positive things? Rainbows. Kittens. Thanksgiving dinner!

Name: HOLT
Text: Hmm. Four highly-trained detectives and not one of you can solve this simple mystery. I want to be briefed on any new angles. Any questions?

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I was curious whether you thought I was doing too much man-scaping, and apparently you do, so I'm good.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, what about that expensive jamon iber-crap stuff? The perp left a really expensive TV behind, but stole ham? Is there a place near the crime scene that sells it?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Beneficio's might. Their cured meats section is ridiculous. Though, I mainly think of it as a gelato place--

Name: JAKE
Text: Stop talking. Let's go.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You gotta brief the C.O. first.

Name: JAKE
Text: We'll brief him after we catch the guy.

Name: RATKO
Text: My name is Ratko, I don't know anything.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, Ratko. Just a few questions. Do you recognize him? Henry Morgenthau?

Name: RATKO
Text: No.

Name: JAKE
Text: Look at the picture first, maybe, Ratko.

Name: RATKO
Text: I tell you. I don't know him. I don't know what happened. No more questions!

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, I'll tell you what happened. He came by and said he had some hams to sell. You knew they were worth a lot of money, so you tried to rob him when he wasn't home. Only he was home, and he fought back, so you shot him. Am I close? Nod your giant caveman head and drool if I'm close.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh man, I hate running! Ratko stop! Stop Ratko!

Name: JAKE
Text: Ow! Ratko, I'm getting mad.

Name: CHARLES
Text: That's thirty dollar marmalade!

Name: RATKO
Text: I not mean to kill. It not my fault.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. Okay. I believe you. Be cool.

Name: CHARLES
Text: It really is the best gelato in the city.

Name: TERRY
Text: What the hell happened? And what's on your face?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Passion fruit sorbet.

Name: JAKE
Text: Good news is: we found the murderer. Ratko Slovic, a Serbian butcher. Robbery gone bad. He confessed and everything.

Name: HOLT
Text: I don't see a Serbian butcher in here, so I assume there's bad news.

Name: JAKE
Text: Charles and I may have allowed Ratko to escape. But, one more piece of good news:

Name: JAKE
Text: (sing-songy) I got you some hazelnut!

Name: JAKE
Text: He's seriously assigning me to the records room? Why do we even have a records room? The computer has been invented, right?

Name: TERRY
Text: You're lucky, man. I wish I could get assigned here full time. You could not be farther from the action.

Name: JAKE
Text: Sergeant, you know me. I have more arrests than anyone. Can you please tell the captain how dumb it is to lock his best detective in a file cabinet?

Name: AMY
Text: Second best.

Name: TERRY
Text: You're wrong about Holt. That man has forgotten more about being a cop than you'll ever know. In 1981, he caught the Disco Strangler.

Name: HOLT
Text: It's over, Disco Man. Put down the yo-yo and back away from the girl.

Name: TERRY
Text: He's the real deal. You should listen to him.

Name: AMY
Text: It's gonna be hard to win our bet when you're on the bench, Peralta. Although, I did start a new category --

Name: AMY
Text: Look at that! You're winning!

Name: JAKE
Text: Slam! That was a slam! Pretend that slammed.

Name: ROSA
Text: So? What movie did you get tickets to?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Well, just to be safe, I bought tickets to all of them.

Name: ROSA
Text: "Just to be safe?" What does that mean?

Name: CHARLES
Text: I don't know. I didn't want to mess up, because you're sort of... opinionated.

Name: ROSA
Text: You think I'm opinionated? Okay, here's an opinion for you: you're a bad judge of character and your shirt looks like vomit.

Name: CHARLES
Text: ...So we could see North by Northwest--

Name: ROSA
Text: We are not seeing a movie together.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Sounds good.

Name: HOLT
Text: So, you found something? I like the tie.

Name: JAKE
Text: I was skeptical, but it really did make a difference in my work. I think I found something interesting in these files. Here, let me show you.

Name: HOLT
Text: I'm glad you've made progress in the case. Let's have you brief the team. Holt grabs Jake's pants and heads towards the bullpen.

Name: JAKE
Text: ...That's not necessary.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes. Well. Thank you all for coming. Including -- oh! -- Craig, our crime scene photographer.

Name: JAKE
Text: Great. So. After being unfairly tossed into the records room for no reason, I got so bored I started reading some old cases.

Name: HOLT
Text: A novel idea.

Name: JAKE
Text: "Ratko" was a made-up name, but: after looking through a million files, one of which I literally found in a spiderweb, I found a bunch of references to a Serbian thug, street names: "The Rat" and "The Butcher." Suspect in a few break-ins -- used to hang out at a storage unit near Boerum Park...which has red soil, hence the muddy red footprints on Monganthau's counter. Also, I am freezing. Can I put my pants on now?

Name: HOLT
Text: Fine work, Detective. Let's give Peralta a hand, everyone.

Name: JAKE
Text: Thank you. Thanks. That's nice.

Name: AMY
Text: No record of Ratko on their ledger. Must have used cash.

Name: HOLT
Text: Maybe we'll get lucky and he'll turn up.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I for one am very excited to be on a stakeout with you, Captain. You know what my fave part of stakeouts is? Patrol guide says: casual dress.

Name: HOLT
Text: Does he always talk this much?

Name: AMY
Text: I just tune it out. It's like a white noise machine.

Name: JAKE
Text: First off, that's racist. Second of all, you caught the Disco Strangler, right? That dude wrapped a lot of yo-yos around a lot of hookers' necks. Nice collar. But the thing I can't understand is: young superstar detective takes down a serial killer... why'd it take you so long to get your first command?

Name: HOLT
Text: Because I'm gay.

Name: JAKE
Text: ...Seriously?

Name: HOLT
Text: I'm surprised you didn't know. I don't try to hide it.

Name: JAKE
Text: Damn. I am not a good detective.

Name: ROSA
Text: Hey. I feel bad that you spent all that money on movie tickets. Take this.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Why don't you just come to the movies?

Name: ROSA
Text: No thanks.

Name: CHARLES
Text: ...Okay. Well. This is awkward.

Name: ROSA
Text: It's not awkward. I like your company. You're sweet.

Name: JAKE
Text: Captain, when I had my pants off, in no way was I... I didn't know about your gay... gayness.

Name: HOLT
Text: I know, Peralta. You're a lot of things, but you're not a homophobe.

Name: AMY
Text: When did you come out?

Name: HOLT
Text: About twenty-five years ago. The NYPD was not ready for an openly gay detective. Then the old guard died, and suddenly, they couldn't wait to show off the fact that they had a high-ranking gay officer. I made captain, but they put me into a public affairs unit. I was a good soldier, helped recruitment... but all I ever wanted was a command. Now, I finally got one, and I'm not going to screw it up.

Name: JAKE
Text: I feel dumb.

Name: AMY
Text: My God. I have to thank you, Captain, because at this moment, Peralta is feeling humility, for maybe the first time in his life. Aren't you, JP?

Name: JAKE
Text: Frankly, yes, I am, and Captain, I'm sorry. But also, look, there's Ratko. Humility over. I'm amazing.

Name: HOLT
Text: Go.

Name: AMY
Text: He couldn't lock himself in. Split up and find the ones that are unlocked.

Name: HOLT
Text: Looks like we all got door duty.

Name: JAKE
Text: I see what you did there. Nice.

Name: PARROT
Text: I'm lonely.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hang in there, buddy.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hello, Ratko.

Name: RATKO
Text: You can't stop me. I'm going.

Name: JAKE
Text: You're not going, actually. Because if you'll just take a quick peek to your right, you'll see Detectives Boyle and Diaz.

Name: JAKE
Text: Over there is Detective Santiago. And behind you is Captain Holt. Can you believe that? A captain, on a stakeout! He's kind of a hands-on dude. Point is, we have you surrounded -- -- oh my God, I figured out the tie thing! Captain -- hey, I figured it out!

Name: HOLT
Text: Maybe now's not the best time, Detective.

Name: JAKE
Text: It's a uniform. We're a team, and ties are part of the uniform for that team. Right.

Name: RATKO
Text: ...You ask Ratko what team?

Name: JAKE
Text: No, Ratko, shut up. It's important to you because you were kept off that team, and now you're the coach and you want us all to wear the same uniform. Boom. I nailed it.

Name: HOLT
Text: Yes, you did. Now, please arrest Ratko.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh -- right. Cool. Okay, Ratko, gun down. Get on the ground and put your hands on your --

Name: JAKE
Text: Ugh. I hate running.

Name: AMY
Text: Got him.

Name: JAKE
Text: That's how we do things in the nine-nine, Captain. We catch bad guys, and we look good doing it.

Name: HOLT
Text: What's wrong with you?

Name: JAKE
Text: Never took off the speedo. Huge mistake. It is inside me. Great job, team!

Name: HOLT
Text: And what's this all about, Detective?

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, the tux? I'm done with work. This is how I dress in my free time.

Name: HOLT
Text: You did well today, Peralta. But you're going to need a little more humility if you're going to make captain one day.

Name: AMY
Text: Him?! If anyone's going to make captain in this bar, it's me. And you, Captain, because you are a captain.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, I don't want your job. That's the last thing I want.

Name: HOLT
Text: Okay. Guess I was mistaken. The beers are on him.

Name: GINA
Text: How'd it go with Rosa?

Name: CHARLES
Text: We will not be seeing a movie. But -- and this is big -- she called me "sweet." Sweet's pretty good, right?

Name: GINA
Text: Sweet's not good. Grow a pair.

Name: JAKE
Text: Gotta give it up, Santiago took him down hard. Well done. (off her smile) It was sexy. I was very into it.

Name: AMY
Text: Ugh, just when you're being sincere, you ruin everything.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, that's kind of my move.

Name: TERRY
Text: Hoo boy. So glad I was not there.

Name: HOLT
Text: I think you would've handled yourself just fine.

Name: HOLT
Text: Every cop is different. Every precinct is different. But this is the nine-nine. You want to be on this team? You grind it. Get cases, work cases, solve cases. The right way. To the detectives of the nine-nine.

Name: JAKE
Text: And to Captain Holt...'s best detective, Jake Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: Ah, Captain. You're at my desk. Just what I wanna see first thing in the morning.

Name: HOLT
Text: You're three minutes late, Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: Not my fault. I had a plumbing problem.

Name: JAKE
Text: Which reminds me, I'm gonna need a new departmentally issued phone. Oh, come on, really? I'm a few minutes late, so you're gonna call me out in front of everyone?

Name: HOLT
Text: Good idea. Everyone? Gather round, so I can call out Peralta in front of you.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, fine. I was three minutes late. I'm sorry for doing one thing wrong.

Name: HOLT
Text: Oh, it's more than one thing.

Name: JAKE
Text: Uh-oh.

Name: HOLT
Text: Let's start with the Kristov murder.

Name: JAKE
Text: It was an amazing solve. I got him to confess in 20 minutes.

Name: HOLT
Text: You also mislabeled the evidence, so that confession is worthless if the sergeant hadn't caught your mistake. Here are three cases with sloppy paperwork. Here are two pictures. One is your locker. The other is a garbage dump in the Philippines. Can you tell which is which?

Name: JAKE
Text: That one's the dump?

Name: HOLT
Text: They're both your locker.

Name: JAKE
Text: Gah, I should've guessed that. He's good.

Name: HOLT
Text: This folder is labeled "undies, dirty."

Name: JAKE
Text: So I won't confuse it with "undies, clean." Also, who cares about all these rules? I have more felony arrests than any other detective here.

Name: HOLT
Text: You also have more mice living in your desk than any other detective.

Name: JAKE
Text: "Algernon." "You guys, Algernon's back."

Name: HOLT
Text: Get rid of the mouse, and get your act together now.

Name: JAKE
Text: He's grumpy.

Name: TERRY
Text: Okay, detectives, let's get started. Santiago, where are we with the Jay Street drug bust?

Name: AMY
Text: There are 12 keys of coke unaccounted for, but we just got a warrant to search the dealer's apartment.

Name: TERRY
Text: Good. Take Boyle and Diaz.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Dream team.

Name: TERRY
Text: Peralta, brief us on the vandalism case.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, there's no easy way to put this, Sarge, but someone has been painting wieners on squad cars.

Name: JAKE
Text: And apparently, they won't stop until there's a penis drawn on every cop car in Brooklyn.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Oh, that's what he's been drawing. But what are those little round things at the bottom?

Name: SCULLY
Text: That's the butt.

Name: JAKE
Text: The butt?

Name: HOLT
Text: I assume you have a plan to catch this gentleman.

Name: JAKE
Text: Did you just say "genital-man"? Because if so, kudos, and yes, I have a plan. I'm gonna plant a decoy squad car as bait. Meanwhile, I'll be waiting in an undercover vehicle here. He's already tagged three U/C vehicles.

Name: TERRY
Text: He can clearly spot 'em. You should take my minivan.

Name: ROSA
Text: A minivan? A-ha!

Name: TERRY
Text: You all got a problem with my minivan?

Name: TERRY
Text: Cause my wife doesn't like it either. She wanted an SUV, but those things roll, man. They roll!

Name: HOLT
Text: That's a good idea, sergeant. We'll take the van.

Name: JAKE
Text: We? You're coming with me? Sir, with all due respect, I don't need backup.

Name: HOLT
Text: It's not backup. It's babysitting.

Name: ROSA
Text: Babysitting. A-ha!

Name: CHARLES
Text: Oh, look at this. The drug dealer got a B.A. in art history from Brooklyn college. Interesting, huh?

Name: ROSA
Text: How's that interesting?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Well, it's surprising because you would think he had studied... drugs.

Name: AMY
Text: I studied art history too.

Name: ROSA
Text: Also not interesting.

Name: GINA
Text: Excuse me. I know I'm just a lowly civilian administrator, but I couldn't help overhearing you're looking for some missing drugs? As it turns out, my friend here, Carlene, is a psychic, and she's ready to help you.

Name: CARLENE
Text: I do palms, tarot, and I have a degree in numerology from the internet.

Name: ROSA
Text: Ugh. Really, Gina? A psychic?

Name: GINA
Text: What? She's the real deal. E.G., last week, she predicted I would have a sensuous encounter with a guy named Mark. And I did.

Name: GINA
Text: Is anyone here named Mark?

Name: GINA
Text: You're good.

Name: GINA
Text: Okay, she's had visions which, frankly, science cannot account for. Also, she can get you amazing deals on ladies' footwear. She's assistant manager at Leonard's designer shoes.

Name: CARLENE
Text: Vision. The drugs are in a location. I see the color blue...

Name: GINA
Text: She sees blue.

Name: CARLENE
Text: And yellow. And I see the letters "L", "R", "S", "T", "W", "E", and "B."

Name: AMY
Text: So basically, everyone's first eight guesses in hangman?

Name: ROSA
Text: Thank you, Carlene. Your entire life is garbage.

Name: JAKE
Text: So Holt's coming on my stakeout now? I made a mixtape with some very explicit rap on it, and now I can't sing along.

Name: TERRY
Text: You made a mixtape?

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes, I still listen to cassettes. This guy is all over me. I mean, a Captain on a minor vandalism case? It's insane.

Name: TERRY
Text: What's insane is how you refuse to get with the program. There is a new sheriff in town, Jake.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I like the old sheriff. I mean, McGintley wouldn't care about a messy desk or all these stupid rules.

Name: ALL
Text: Tase, tase, tase, tase, tase...

Name: MCGINTLEY
Text: Hey! What the hell's going on here?

Name: JAKE
Text: Science experiment. I wanna see what happens if I taser this cantaloupe.

Name: MCGINTLEY
Text: Okay.

Name: ALL
Text: Tase, tase, tase, tase, tase... Aha. Oh! Yeah!

Name: JAKE
Text: And McGintley wouldn't care if I was three minutes late 'cause he was always an hour late and hungover, and he would let you do literally anything you want if you gave him a hamburger.

Name: TERRY
Text: Did he let you play your mixtape?

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. That's very funny.

Name: TERRY
Text: Get an iPod, man.

Name: JAKE
Text: Mixtape.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I just want to apologize for my fellow detectives' behavior. Okay, my granny also had the gift.

Name: GRANNY
Text: I feel that I will die soon.

Name: CHARLES
Text: She was right. She died two years later.

Name: CARLENE
Text: Your sincere belief in my gift means a great deal. Vision. The woman you love, the one you work with, the scary one with the black hair...

Name: CHARLES
Text: Rosa. Yes?

Name: CARLENE
Text: She doesn't love you back. She will never love you back.

Name: GINA
Text: Say "thank you," Charles. She just told you your future.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Thank you.

Name: JAKE
Text: You left without me.

Name: HOLT
Text: You were late again.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I had to put on my undercover minivan disguise. Say hello to Harvey Norgenbloom, CPA, recently divorced father of two with a dark sexual secret. What's your cover?

Name: HOLT
Text: Angry Captain.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, so you do not like my ensemble.

Name: HOLT
Text: I'm just concerned that you may find it hard to pursue a criminal on foot while wearing man sandals.

Name: JAKE
Text: But the sandals define Harvey. He's a sandals guy. [sighs] Captain, why the babysitting? Why are you micromanaging me?

Name: HOLT
Text: You think I wanna be sitting here with you instead of running my precinct?

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes.

Name: HOLT
Text: It was a rhetorical question. I've spent the last 12 years fighting for my first command, and I'm not gonna let you screw it up because you refuse to take your job seriously.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, I do take my job seriously. I put away bad guys. That's what matters.

Name: HOLT
Text: Well, so does doing your paperwork, showing up on time, wearing proper footwear.

Name: JAKE
Text: That's on Harvey. That's not me.

Name: HOLT
Text: Well, so here's the deal. You're gonna have a superior officer babysitting you on every one of your cases. And when you show me that you can do your job... Every part of your job... Perfectly, then I'll back off.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. Counteroffer. I give you 50 bucks, and you let me do whatever I want. Fine. We'll do it your way. From this point on, I'll do every part of the job perfectly, perfecter than perfectly.

Name: HOLT
Text: It's "more perfectly." You said that imperfectly.

Name: JAKE
Text: I was testing you. You did perfectly. Quick update on the tagger situation... He is currently spray-painting our van right now.

Name: HOLT
Text: Police, freeze!

Name: JAKE
Text: Ow, ow, ow. Sandal down. Lost a sandal. NYPD, freeze! I'm here. You're busted.

Name: HOLT
Text: Already got him.

Name: JAKE
Text: We got him.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, hey, Captain. Hi, so I was able to procure that $50 after all, and my offer still stands. Let me do whatever I want, and the $40... That's how much I actually have... is yours. No? Fair enough. I only had 30 anyways. Well, I guess in order to get you to stop micromanaging me, I'm gonna have to get back to the most important piece of police work there is

Name: JAKE
Text: And I'm anxious to restore my status as a lone wolf. [Howls]

Name: HOLT
Text: Anything else, Detective?

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, I'm gonna do one more. [Howls] Lone wolf. He's digging me.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, Sarge, do you know where we keep the glitter? Just wanna make sure this report for the Captain is extra sparkly.

Name: TERRY
Text: What are you doing, Peralta?

Name: JAKE
Text: Look, if I have to do things his way, I'm gonna do them my way.

Name: TERRY
Text: [laughs] Okay, man. It was nice working with you.

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm not scared of him, okay? I'm not scared of anyone. Oh, also, The Tagger drew a penis on your minivan. I'm sorry. Please don't chase after me.

Name: TERRY
Text: What? There's a penis on my minivan?

Name: AMY
Text: High ceilings, three bedrooms. Why does every perp have a nicer place than I do?

Name: ROSA
Text: You know what they don't teach you at the academy? It's better to be a criminal.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Oh, no. The cabinets are blue.

Name: AMY
Text: Tacky. Not a deal breaker, though. I'd just repaint it.

Name: CHARLES
Text: The psychic predicted the drugs would be found in something blue.

Name: CARLENE
Text: I see the color blue.

Name: CHARLES
Text: She also made this really depressing prediction about my life.

Name: CARLENE
Text: She will never love you back.

Name: CHARLES
Text: And if she's right about where we find the drugs, that means she's right about the other thing.

Name: AMY
Text: Uh-huh. Kitchen. Whoa. Jackpot. There's way more than 12 keys in here.

Name: ROSA
Text: Where was it?

Name: AMY
Text: Baseboard, behind the hamper.

Name: CHARLES
Text: What color was the hamper?

Name: AMY
Text: Green.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yes. The clothes hamper was green. The clothes hamper was green! Drinks on me.

Name: ROSA
Text: [laughs] You're weird.

Name: JAKE
Text: Sorry this is taking so long. Still writing up my report. Pretty detailed. Hey, Gina, can you look up what the humidity was about an hour ago and also what moon cycle we're in?

Name: GINA
Text: No, sorry. Don't feel like it, no.

Name: JAKE
Text: Thanks, Gina. And now to you. What's your name?

Name: PRIVILEGED KID
Text: My name is Banana Fartman, MD.

Name: JAKE
Text: I don't believe you. Come on, man. Just tell me who you are. I need to fill this thing out perfectly, so my boss will get off my back. Are you a minor? How old are you?

Name: PRIVILEGED KID
Text: I'm 610. I'm a highlander.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, you know what? I'm gonna put that in there. And then you're gonna be tried as an adult highlander. And they're gonna cut your head off. Is that what you want?

Name: CHARLES
Text: I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but your psychic friend's predictions about the drug case were wrong, which means all of her predictions are wrong.

Name: GINA
Text: Mm-mm. No way. She's never wrong.

Name: CHARLES
Text: We found the cocaine behind a green hamper. Never said green or the letter "H."

Name: GINA
Text: Mm-hmm, she said "blue" and "yellow," Charles. I don't know if there's any kindergarteners present, but those two colors combined make green. She also mentioned the letters "L" and "B," and another name for a hamper is...

Name: CHARLES
Text: Lady bin?

Name: GINA
Text: Laundry basket. Oh, little boo-boo. Can you go be depressed over there? You're bumming out my whole area.

Name: TERRY
Text: Baby, I've got some bad news. Someone painted a giant penis on our minivan. No, you cannot have an SUV now. Those things roll, baby. They roll!

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, look at this. Your prints were on file. Nice to meet you, Trevor Podolski. Oh, Podolski, just like Deputy Police Commissioner Podolski. Your father is Deputy Police Commissioner Podolski.

Name: TREVOR
Text: I'm not sure how things work here, but does that mean that your career is in my hands?

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, you know what? Yes.

Name: AMY
Text: 20.2 kilos. I feel like we could round up to 21.

Name: GINA
Text: Or we could round down to 20, take the extra 0.2, sell it to our friends.

Name: AMY
Text: I'll call the D.A. Rosa, you log this in. Charles, maybe watch Gina.

Name: ROSA
Text: So what are you doing tonight?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Nothing. What about you... are doing tonight?

Name: ROSA
Text: Nothing.

Name: GINA
Text: Carlene.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Whelp, I hope you find something to do. I'm gonna pee. That's what I'm doing tonight. No.

Name: HOLT
Text: Deputy Commissioner's son, huh? His decision to target cop cars makes a lot more sense now.

Name: JAKE
Text: We gotta let him walk, right?

Name: HOLT
Text: He defaced nine police vehicles, and you caught him red-handed. Why would you let him walk?

Name: JAKE
Text: Captain, I did all the work on this perfectly. [pulls up his report] I mean, my report has over 25 pages of meticulous research, diagrams, and maps. I even put an "About the Author" section on the back. [flips it to show a dramatic picture of him on the back] I did everything you asked me to do. But this is above my pay grade. You gotta make the call.

Name: HOLT
Text: You're the arresting office. It's your call. I told you to do every part of your job, and making this call is part of your job.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, but you think I should process him.

Name: HOLT
Text: Mm-hmm.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, if I do, the Deputy Commissioner could ruin my career, and I'll end up on the streets selling my beautiful body for a can of beans.

Name: HOLT
Text: Mm-hmm.

Name: JAKE
Text: Has anyone ever told you you look exactly like a statue?

Name: HOLT
Text: Yes.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Man, you were totally right about the cocaine, and you were also right about Rosa.

Name: CARLENE
Text: Who's Rosa?

Name: CHARLES
Text: The woman I--

Name: GINA
Text: The woman who doesn't love him back.

Name: CARLENE
Text: Oh.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yes, that woman.

Name: CARLENE
Text: You know, it can be a burden to always know what's gonna happen in the future.

Name: CARLENE
Text: Don't get out of the chair! I just had a vision of you leaving this chair and getting seriously injured.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Oh, my god.

Name: GINA
Text: I should probably wheel you back to your desk.

Name: CARLENE
Text: That is a great idea.

Name: GINA
Text: Wheel you off a bridge. I'm kidding. Oh, you're alone. Uh-oh, you're alone for life.

Name: JAKE
Text: So here are my options. One, I process Podolski's kid, he fires me, and I spend the rest of my career as a detective, third grade, which is literally pathetic. No offense, Hitchcock.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: None taken.

Name: JAKE
Text: Option two, I let him walk, and I spend the rest of my life with Holt as my babysitter. Honestly, when I think about spending the rest of my life with a babysitter, she's kind of a cute blond named Erica, and she always has pizza money and lets me stay up as late as I want.

Name: AMY
Text: How old are you in this scenario?

Name: JAKE
Text: Anyway, the point is Holt cares more about whether I "do my job right" than whether I have a job at all. So I'm taking suggestions.

Name: AMY
Text: I say piss off Holt, so we get to watch your career end right in front of us.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, thank you for that, Santiago. [turns to his whiteboard and puts a mark under dont arrest'] I'm gonna put you down for "don't arrest," and I'm also going to put your phone number on every urinal in Rikers.

Name: ROSA
Text: Don't arrest him. Just smack him. Hard. With a phone book on a body part no one can see, you know what I'm saying?

Name: JAKE
Text: So you're suggesting police brutality?

Name: ROSA
Text: Ha, ha, I guess so, yeah. Why?

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, Scully.

Name: SCULLY
Text: Yeah?

Name: JAKE
Text: You want this collar? Paperwork's all done, and it's perfect.

Name: SCULLY
Text: The Podolski kid? Are you kidding? I just gave him my lunch.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. Boyle, what do you think?

Name: CHARLES
Text: I don't know, man. I'm lost. The universe is a cruel and vexing puzzle. I-I'm at the whim of the cosmos.

Name: JAKE
Text: Alright, I'm gonna put you down for "bummer." And you can hang out in that category all by yourself.

Name: GINA
Text: Hey, everyone. Hey, Jake, there is a very sexy, angry official here, Deputy Commissioner Podolski. He's asking for you. Very angry. Elderly, sexy, furious. [walks away]

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, my career is over. See you at the bottom, Hitchcock. No offense.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: No, none taken.

Name: JAKE
Text: Deputy Commissioner.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Where's my son?

Name: JAKE
Text: He is at my desk, enjoying a nice glass of bubbly water and some chocolate I was saving for a special occasion.

Name: AMY
Text: Hey, Peralta, when you're done, can you help me wrap up this massive cocaine bust I just pulled off? Thanks. Oh, Deputy Commissioner, didn't see you there. Sorry for interrupting. Amy Santiago.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Trevor, what'd you do this time?

Name: TREVOR
Text: Nothing.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: There you have it. He said he did nothing.

Name: JAKE
Text: So I caught him red-handed doing nothing?

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: I'm saying maybe it's a possibility you made a mistake.

Name: JAKE
Text: You know, normally, I would agree with you, but I've been pretty detail-oriented the last few hours.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: You might not understand this, but Trevor is a special kid. He makes straight A's. He's going to Duke next year. Lacrosse scholarship.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Sometimes, boys just need to be boys.

Name: JAKE
Text: You do realize he did thousands of dollars worth of property damage, though, to police vehicles.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Look, I think we can all agree that I'm ordering you to let this slide because nothing happened. This is officially out of your hands.

Name: JAKE
Text: Would you actually mind just checking out my report? It's pretty thorough, and I spent over an hour on fonts. Kinda snazzy, soâ€¦

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Oh, thank you. I'll get right to it.

Name: JAKE
Text: Thanks.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: Trevor, let's go.

Name: JAKE
Text: Have a good one.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Choo. [opens fridge] Yes.

Name: ROSA
Text: What's up with the chair?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Um, Carlene predicted if I get out of this chair, I'd get badly hurt, so I'm not chancing it. Oh, man. There's no more pudding cups left.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Ah! What'd you do that for?

Name: ROSA
Text: There. Now you're hurt in this chair. You can get hurt anywhere, Boyle. And if you do, it won't be because some shoe salesman predicted it. You make your own destiny.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, we don't have to worry about Podolski's son anymore. The case is officially out of my hands. No charges filed.

Name: HOLT
Text: Why is there yogurt on this?

Name: JAKE
Text: The Deputy Commissioner threw my report in Terry's trash can, and he'd been eating yogurt earlier.

Name: HOLT
Text: Terry loves yogurt. Something wrong?

Name: JAKE
Text: Kinda, yeah. I called six precincts about this kid. He's been brought in a dozen times. Theft, vandalism, drunken disorderly, but he's never been processed. His daddy comes in and bails him out every time. He's a lucky little jerk.

Name: HOLT
Text: No, I wouldn't say he was lucky. I feel bad for this kid. I mean, what kind of father cares so little for his son that he lets him get away with everything? Well, he's someone else's problem now. Like you said, it's out of your hands.

Name: JAKE
Text: Alright, I see what you're trying to do, but it's not gonna work. I'm not going to arrest him. I'm going to arrest him!

Name: HOLT
Text: You want backup?

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: What is this? You can't do this. Get that thing out of here.

Name: JAKE
Text: Excuse me, sir. Trevor Podolski, you're under arrest for vandalism and destruction of property.

Name: TREVOR
Text: What--Dad!

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: What are you doing? I told you to back off, Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: First off, the name's Santiago, Detective Amy Santiago. Second, I'm arresting your son, which, as I say it aloud, seems like an unwise choice, but it's the one I'm making. Once again, my name is Amy Santiago.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: You're being stupid, Peralta. Don't be stupid. I can make your life miserable.

Name: HOLT
Text: Commissioner, please don't talk to my detective in that tone. If you have a complaint, you can take it up with me.

Name: PODOLSKI
Text: You just made yourself a very powerful enemy, Holt. I'm gonna be watching you, both of you, like a hawk.

Name: HOLT
Text: You're gonna have to try a little harder if you wanna scare me. I've been an openly gay cop since 1987, so you're not the first superior officer to threaten me. You know how I'm still standing here? Cause I do my job, and I do it right. [walks back to police car]

Name: JAKE
Text: Damn, son!

Name: HOLT
Text: Don't say "son."

Name: JAKE
Text: Sorry. Deputy Commissioner, if you wanna pick Trevor up, he'll be at the Nine-Nine. [walks back to police car] Let's go, Fartman.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Carlene was wrong, Gina. Rosa said it herself-- I'm in charge of my own destiny. That means she wants me to make a move.

Name: GINA
Text: Mm, but Carlene was also right. You did get hurt cause Rosa punched you. And the fact that Rosa punched you means she does not like you.

Name: CHARLES
Text: No, no, she punched me to prove Carlene wrong.

Name: ROSA
Text: Move.

Name: GINA
Text: Oh, wait, I take it back. She definitely is into you. So much chemistry.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I know, it's crazy.

Name: HOLT
Text: Alright, let's get this meeting started.

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm not late. I'm here.Right on time.

Name: HOLT
Text: You're out of uniform, Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: Baby steps, Captain. Baby steps.

Name: AMY
Text: For the last time, the best cop movies, in order: Training Day, Lethal Weapon, and Fargo. End of discussion.

Name: JAKE
Text: Wrong. Die Hard is the best cop movie of all time. One cop heroically saving the day while everyone else stands around and watches. It's the story of my life.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I like Turner & Hooch. Tom Hanks, reluctant friendship with a dog. That hits me where I live.

Name: ROSA
Text: No. Robocop. It's got everything I like--gratuitous violence.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, I thought you were listing things.

Name: ROSA
Text: I was. I'm done.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay.

Name: GINA
Text: Let's talk Bad Boys. That's the perfect cop movie. Mr. Smith, lookin' fine. A hot cup of tea leone. Come on.

Name: TERRY
Text: Francois Truffaut's Breathless. What? Terry likes foreign films.

Name: JAKE
Text: Mm-kay. There is a correct answer to this question, though. So gather around for the greatest cop film of all time. Please refrain from texting during our presentation. [clicks something on his computer and video feed pops up] All right, so there's Hitchcock. And there's an old hooker. There it is!

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Come on, guys, that happened four years ago.

Name: JAKE
Text: Shh, this is the best part. She comes back, takes the wallet and here she goes!

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, love the sweater. Who you slayin' tonight, lady killer?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Well, we shall see what we shall see.

Name: JAKE
Text: No, you're dressed exactly like The Lady Killer.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Damn it! This is Jeffrey Dahmer's corduroys all over again.

Name: TERRY
Text: All right, let's get started. Scully. Where are you on digitizing the old case files?

Name: SCULLY
Text: As of yesterday, I'm officially 1% done.

Name: TERRY
Text: Why are you smiling? That's nothin'.

Name: SCULLY
Text: There's thousands of cases, and for each one, I have to fill out 200 little box thingies on 50 different screens.

Name: ROSA
Text: At least you get to sit on your butt all day.

Name: SCULLY
Text: That's actually the worst part. My doctor said I have an anal canyon.

Name: JAKE
Text: Ugh, god, Scully. Why are you always telling us about your disgusting body?

Name: JAKE
Text: I don't see anything.

Name: SCULLY
Text: That's because it's all wart.

Name: JAKE
Text: How are you married?

Name: HOLT
Text: Peralta, where are we on the Adams Street burglary?

Name: JAKE
Text: We are very close, Captain. Aside from a complete absence of evidence, suspects, or leads. So, in conclusion, not at all close.

Name: HOLT
Text: And the Vickers Street aggravated assault?

Name: JAKE
Text: Stalled out, and the Calloway robbery also remains unsolved.. Due to a lack of solving it by me.

Name: GINA
Text: Sounds like someone's in a little bit of a slump.

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm not in a slump.

Name: AMY
Text: You're not?

Name: JAKE
Text: I don't slump, people. I opposite slump. I p-muls. That's "slump" backwards, and it's what I do. I p-muls all over this bitch.

Name: TERRY
Text: Dismissed.

Name: AMY
Text: Slump.

Name: JAKE
Text: P-muls!

Name: JAKE
Text: Wait...Before you say anything, I want to guess what happened, based on your face. Someone died. No! You won a prize! I'm not getting better at this.

Name: HOLT
Text: I'm concerned that the open cases mound of garbage on your desk has become so much higher than the closed cases mound of garbage.

Name: JAKE
Text: All right, sir. Let me hit you with a little analogy. Are you familiar with racecars?

Name: HOLT
Text: Formula 1 or Stock?

Name: JAKE
Text: That's already way more than I know about it. The point is, I'm a super-awesome race car who's hit a couple of unlucky speed bumps.

Name: HOLT
Text: You got speed bumps on a race track?

Name: JAKE
Text: Is that not part of car racing? It should be. All I'm saying is, it's open road again. I'm about to close a case. Missing grandma Helen Sterrino. Last Sunday, her grandson Judd reported she went out for bagels and never came back. [hands report to Holt] This morning, we picked up an old lady matching her description exactly. I showed her pictures of Judd, and she said, and I quote, [imitating old lady] 'That's my grandson.'

Name: HOLT
Text: What did I say about doing voices?

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm a storyteller, sir. It's my craft. [takes report back from Holt] Anyways, grandson's coming in. They reunite, and I throw another case on the old "Solved it" pile. [puts file on a stack of other files and it falls off his desk] Hey my croissant. [picks up croissant that was under the stacks of papers then bangs it on the desk, showing it's rock solid, and proceeds to eat it]

Name: AMY
Text: You wanted to see me, Captain?

Name: HOLT
Text: Yes, the D. A. wanted me to personally thank you for your work on the Jay Street drug bust.

Name: AMY
Text: That's why we do this, sir.

Name: HOLT
Text: For praise?

Name: AMY
Text: Uh...

Name: HOLT
Text: There's a community outreach program that's very important to me. I was wondering if you'd like to head it up.

Name: AMY
Text: Absolutely, sir. I won't just head it up, I will head and shoulders it up. I will dive in, swim around it, and just be altogether good with it.

Name: HOLT
Text: Be more articulate when you speak to the children.

Name: AMY
Text: Yes, sir, I will make better mouth.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey, Sarge, I need someone to fill out a lineup. Will you be Scary Terry?

Name: TERRY
Text: Oh, I love being Scary Terry. He says what regular Terry's thinking.

Name: TERRY
Text: This is takin' too long! I'm gonna miss the farmer's market!

Name: TERRY
Text: But I'm too busy. I've got a special case I'm working on. Uh, Hitchcock, Boyle needs you to fill out a lineup.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Oh, great. I'll take my shirt off.

Name: CHARLES
Text: No one asked you to take your shirt off. Stop volunteering to take your shirt off.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: I can't hear you! Shirt's over my ears.

Name: AMY
Text: Hi, Rosa. Ooh, I like your shoes. They're a really pretty--

Name: ROSA
Text: What do you need?

Name: AMY
Text: --Color. Okay. You know how, every year, the precinct does that junior police program seminar?

Name: ROSA
Text: That thing where we try to get a bunch of loser kids to become student snitches?

Name: AMY
Text: No, the thing where we try to get at-risk kids--

Name: ROSA
Text: Losers.

Name: AMY
Text: To sign up to become junior police officers.

Name: ROSA
Text: Snitches. What about it?

Name: AMY
Text: Captain specifically asked me to run it this year. I signed you up to do it with me. Here's the info. [handing packet to Rosa]

Name: ROSA
Text: Now I gotta read something?

Name: GINA
Text: Greetings. Fine. I guess I can help you with those at-risk kids.

Name: AMY
Text: [scoffs] I don't need your help. It's nothing personal. It's just... You're not a cop, so I'm not really sure you could help.

Name: GINA
Text: Okay. No hard feelings. But I hate you. Not joking. Bye.

Name: JAKE
Text: Ah, Mr. and Mrs. Terrino. I'm glad you're here. May I present to you... [imitates trumpet fanfare while showing the family the old lady]

Name: OLD LADY
Text: Oh, my darlings. Thank god I found you. Oh, look at those beautiful cheeks.

Name: MR. TERRINO
Text: I have no idea who this lady is. I've never seen her before in my life.

Name: JAKE
Text: What? No, she recognized you. This is Helen.

Name: OLD LADY
Text: Who's Helen? Oh! That's my husband. Solomon. [hugs Charles]

Name: CHARLES
Text: I'm--I'm not really her husband.

Name: OLD LADY
Text: You're so much shorter than you used to be. What did the Japanese do to you?

Name: JAKE
Text: Different generation.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Okay, this is Ethel Musterberg from the Prospect Heights Senior Center. There was an I.D. card in her back pocket.

Name: TERRY
Text: Why was your hand in her back pocket?

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, she told me she didn't have any I.D., and unlike Boyle, my first instinct was not to caress her butt.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Frisked! I frisked her butt!

Name: HOLT
Text: It looks like this case remains unsolved, Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, my god. I'm in a slump!

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, cool. You're all here in the break room.

Name: ROSA
Text: You asked us to come in here.

Name: JAKE
Text: What? Here's a hypothetical question. Let's say I knew someone that, for the first time in their career, was experiencing, like, a minor slump. What do you think you would suggest to that person if they were going through that?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Well, I haven't really been in a slump since my divorce. So I'd tell this person, "Maybe get divorced." He'd have to get married first.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, so the suggestion to beat is get married and then divorced. Rosa?

Name: ROSA
Text: Fly to Montreal, hit a classy hotel bar, bone a stranger, slump over.

Name: JAKE
Text: Wow, that sounds amazing.

Name: ROSA
Text: Yeah.

Name: JAKE
Text: That's a good one. Sarge, what would you do?

Name: TERRY
Text: 10,000 sit-ups.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay, do you have a backup plan in case my hypothetical person can only do 9,500, or 3?

Name: HOLT
Text: What's going on in here?

Name: CHARLES
Text: We're helping Jake's friend get out of his slump.

Name: HOLT
Text: Or try working a case until it's solved, Peralta. I always find that closing cases is the best way to end the slump.

Name: JAKE
Text: Thank you, Captain!

Name: TERRY
Text: He's right. You just need a win. Pick your easiest, no-brainer case, and work it till it's done.

Name: JAKE
Text: Fine! Right after I do Rosa's Montreal sex thing. That sounds fun.

Name: ROSA
Text: Yeah.

Name: AMY
Text: Okay, this is the Junior Police Program. AKA "Mission Possible." [clicks something and the TV starts playing spy music] Your mission, should you choose to accept it, [pointing at the kids as she walks back and forth] is to get your life back on track.

Name: GINA
Text: [coughs] Narc!

Name: AMY
Text: Hey, Gina. What are you doing?

Name: GINA
Text: Oh, hi, Amy. Since I have nothing to offer, and since I'm not a cop, I thought I'd just show up and learn.

Name: AMY
Text: Do you wanna help me out here?

Name: ROSA
Text: Nah, I think I'm good.

Name: AMY
Text: I know you think getting in trouble is cool. But let me show you what can happen if you continue down this path. [using a different voice] Hey, yo, I'm an at-risk kid, and I think it's cool to sell drugs.

Name: KID
Text: Hold up--Why does the kid selling drugs sound like he's black?

Name: AMY
Text: He's not.

Name: GINA
Text: Well, why not? Are you saying that black people can't sell drugs?

Name: AMY
Text: No, I'm not saying that.

Name: KID
Text: We have a black president. Why can't black people sell drugs?

Name: AMY
Text: I'm so confused.

Name: GINA
Text: Black people can sell drugs!

Name: TERRY
Text: [muffled grunting] Don't make me hit you again.

Name: TERRY
Text: Um...I'm building this dollhouse for my girls. It's their birthday tomorrow. I told my wife I'd get it done.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I had the same exact one when I was a kid!

Name: LITTLE GIRL
Text: Mom, Charles is hogging my doll house!

Name: KID CHARLES
Text: Grandma bought it for the both of us!

Name: CHARLES
Text: You want some help, big man?

Name: TERRY
Text: No! I can do this. It's just driving me a little crazy. Where do I affix the princess tower, Boyle?! Where do I affix it?!

Name: CHARLES
Text: On the side of the turret--

Name: TERRY
Text: Not now, Boyle. Let a brother breathe. Let a brother breathe.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Why would I swap cases with you? I got multiple calls that a guy in the Sackett Towers is dealing meth out of his apartment. It's a guaranteed arrest.

Name: JAKE
Text: And therefore will have a ton of paperwork. Which I know you hate. I have a murder here with no leads and no evidence. It's unsolvable, and thus... shall have no paperwork.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: You had me at "No paperwork."

Name: JAKE
Text: That was the very end of the sentence. All right, Boyle. Let's hit it.

Name: HOLT
Text: So, where are you going, Peralta?

Name: JAKE
Text: I am on my way to ending the slump. I got a dunker, Captain. Nothin' but net.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey, slump, you're about to get nailed by the Jake Hammer.

Name: HOLT
Text: So you haven't solved any of your old cases, and yet you've taken on a new one. I mean, shouldn't you at least solve this Helen Sterrino missing grandmother case first?

Name: JAKE
Text: Or I could solve a super easy one, get my mojo back, and move on to catching The Zodiac Killer. Am I getting ahead of myself?

Name: CHARLES
Text: No, you are not, Jake Rabbit.

Name: JAKE
Text: I like Jake Hammer better. Let's go. Ah.

Name: AMY
Text: I did not think getting these kids to sign up would be this hard.

Name: ROSA
Text: [scoffs] These kids don't wanna listen to you. You're like... Smart and articulate.

Name: AMY
Text: So are you! Why am I offended by that?

Name: ROSA
Text: They don't identify with you because you're not from the streets. I am. Follow, watch, learn. All right, listen up. [rips earbuds out of two girls ears] I know you think you're badasses. But deep down, you're scared. How do I know? Because I've been that same scared kid, and if you don't get your crap together, I'm gonna end up busting you and throwing you in jail. Got it?

Name: KID
Text: Remix, yo!

Name: ROSA
Text: What's happening?

Name: AMY
Text: I think they're laughing at you.

Name: ROSA
Text: That's never happened before. I don't like it.

Name: JAKE
Text: NYPD, hands where I can see them.

Name: OLD MAN
Text: Don't shoot! I was just practicing my minuets, but I'll hold it down.

Name: JAKE
Text: All right, flute man, who else is in this apartment? Where's the dealer?

Name: FLUTE MAN
Text: I live here alone with my birds.

Name: JAKE
Text: What, you don't think I know this M.O.? These are mules. They're drug mules. They're bird mule drugs. Drug bird mules.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Apartment's clear.

Name: JAKE
Text: We got multiple calls about a dealer here.

Name: FLUTE MAN
Text: I bet it's the silly kids down the hall. They love prank calling me. The only drugs in this apartment are for my heart, my liver, my kidney, my salivary glands, and my penis and my feet.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Oh, bird pooped on your shoulder. No, wait... Pooped on your head, then dripped onto your shoulder.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I'm telling you, it's good luck.

Name: JAKE
Text: No, it isn't, okay? That's just something people say when a bird poops on you to make you feel better because it's terrible.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Fore, comin' in!

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, come on.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: I was at the crime scene. This guy comes up out of nowhere, confesses. Well, he says he's gotta make things right, so helps me track down his accomplices.

Name: JAKE
Text: That is so great, man. Looks like everything's comin' up Hitchcock.

Name: GINA
Text: Hey, Jake. You busy?

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes, I very clearly am busy.

Name: GINA
Text: The medical examiner's office just called. They mishandled some evidence. So the D.A.'s gonna have to dismiss your last two busts.

Name: JAKE
Text: [sighs] Great. And the slump gets worse.

Name: GINA
Text: I don't think it's a slump. Honestly, you are straight-up cursed.

Name: JAKE
Text: Good to know. Can you hand me a paper towel, please, Gina?

Name: GINA
Text: There's no more left.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yeah, that sounds right.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey.

Name: HOLT
Text: You're dripping on my carpet.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh, don't worry, sir. It's just urinal water. Clean urinal water.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You could eat off his shirt.

Name: HOLT
Text: Why would I ever eat off his shirt?

Name: JAKE
Text: Look, sir, I don't know what's going on, but I think I'm cursed.

Name: HOLT
Text: Cursed, huh?

Name: JAKE
Text: The freakiest things have been happening to me. I mean, I can't solve a case to save my life. Birds are unloading on me left and right. And, two seconds ago...

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, Sarge, do we have any old t-shirts in here?

Name: JAKE
Text: Cursed.

Name: HOLT
Text: Yeah, I've seen this kind of thing before. It happened to a friend of mine back in the 1-8. Detective Smith. We called him Smitty. He thought he was cursed, and because cops are superstitious, the whole precinct thought he was cursed.

Name: JAKE
Text: But then he found a case, and he solved it. And now he's married to Kate Upton.

Name: HOLT
Text: No. No one would go out on calls with him. He responded to a riot at a gym without backup, and got beaten up by a girls' volleyball team. It was actually quite violent.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Man... Girls are so scary.

Name: HOLT
Text: I don't want you out in the field again, Peralta. I'm pulling you from casework. You can digitize old files with Scully.

Name: JAKE
Text: You're benching me? No, no, no, look-- I've got a plan. Give all my open cases to Hitchcock, who's suddenly on a roll, and assign me 20 fresh ones. Eventually, my luck will turn.

Name: HOLT
Text: No, I don't think that's what's best for you or the squad. Not until this blows over.

Name: JAKE
Text: And how long will that be?

Name: HOLT
Text: Could be a week, could be a month.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Could be a year. Could be a decade. Sorry, we're just saying bigger and bigger numbers.

Name: AMY
Text: I don't know how to connect with these kids. They're mean and shallow and respect nothing. I mean, what kind of person would they even listen to?

Name: GINA
Text: Hitchcock, stop bringing your food in little tupperware containers. It hurts my fingers when I'm trying to open it.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: Sorry!

Name: AMY
Text: Hey, Gina. That's a super cute--

Name: GINA
Text: What do you want?

Name: AMY
Text: --Sweater. Okay. Rosa and I think it would be great if you talked to the kids.

Name: GINA
Text: Mm, I thought only cops could help.

Name: ROSA
Text: In this case, not being a cop might actually be better.

Name: GINA
Text: Mm, that's true. In all cases, cops are the worst.

Name: JAKE
Text: "Enter the numbers from this report into the corresponding boxes on the screen. Then fill out these fields." And I'm in a coma. Hey, Hitchcock. Help me out, man. I'm so bored. Let me jump back on that murder with you.

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: No. I got it.

Name: JAKE
Text: Come on, man, let me just--

Name: HITCHCOCK
Text: No, don't touch it! You're contagious. Everything could fall apart!

Name: HOLT
Text: Peralta, leave Hitchcock alone! Come here. I got in touch with Smitty. He says that you should rub this rabbit's foot with your left forefinger and your pinky, like this, for good luck. Okay? Now you try it.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. Yep. It's definitely helping. I can feel it. The curse is lifting off of me. Ah, hand cramp!

Name: HOLT
Text: Rub, rub, rub.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You okay?

Name: TERRY
Text: The fairy princess castle has defeated me. I'm a grown man with man hands and a man brain. I should be able to put together a dollhouse in less than four hours. Why does it have to be so hard? Look... This screw has three point sides. And nowhere to screw it in! [screw clatters to floor] And there's wheels. What kind of castle has wheels? [screams as he starts destroying what's left of the castle]

Name: JAKE
Text: 117A. Yes. 117B. Yes. 118A. Wait a minute. Hey, just heading to the can.

Name: HOLT
Text: Take the rabbit's foot.

Name: JAKE
Text: Roger that.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey. What's going on?

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, I'm not allowed to leave my desk, so we have to meet in here.

Name: CHARLES
Text: So what you're saying is that this is kind of a...

Name: JAKE
Text: No, for the last time, Charles, we don't need a clubhouse.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You know what I'm thinking?

Name: JAKE
Text: No clubhouse.

Name: JAKE
Text: I need you to make these calls for me. Don't let Holt see you. But if my hunch is right, the slump is over. Come through for me, Boyle.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You know I will.

Name: JAKE
Text: All right.

Name: CHARLES
Text: I'm just saying, put a couple leather chairs in here.

Name: JAKE
Text: Go!

Name: GINA
Text: Children, your problem is not that you're troubled or at-risk or bad dressers. Is that a trucker hat? Still? Come on. Your problem... is that you don't have passion for anything. My life turned around when I found my passion. And today, well I hope to inspire you with it. [clicks to turn on Christina Aguilera's Beautiful and she starts dancing, after a while she shuts off the music and sits on the table] What are we thinking? Yes, in the denim.

Name: KID #2
Text: I think I speak for everyone when I say your weird dancing was just weird.

Name: GINA
Text: Fine. Cops make $52,000 a year. You never have to stop at a red light. And you get to carry a gun. Who wants in? Boom, boom, boom, boom, boom. Yes.

Name: AMY
Text: Oh, my god. You got eight kids to sign up. How did you know that would work?

Name: GINA
Text: That's what made me sign up when I was a kid.

Name: ROSA
Text: You did this program?

Name: GINA
Text: Mm-hmm. Yeah. It does not work.

Name: CHARLES
Text: They're here.

Name: JAKE
Text: Fantastic. Too dramatic?

Name: CHARLES
Text: No.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hi.

Name: MR. TERRINO
Text: Why are we in the bathroom?

Name: JAKE
Text: I thought you might ask that, and I will answer in due time. But first, I know what happened to your grandma. Nothing.

Name: MR. TERRINO
Text: What are you talking about?

Name: JAKE
Text: The reason I couldn't find her is because she never existed. I had Detective Boyle make some calls, and it turns out you've done this before. Five missing persons reports in five different states. [hands Mr. Terrino the reports] Recognize this?

Name: MR. TERRINO
Text: What are you accusing us of?

Name: JAKE
Text: Probably insurance fraud. Definitely filing a false report and obstruction of justice. Now, you were wondering why we did this in the bathroom. It's because you're full of crap.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Blammo! Jake Hammer strikes again.

Name: JAKE
Text: Jake Hammer strikes again.

Name: HOLT
Text: Detectives. I see we got eight recruits for the Junior Police Program. Outstanding.

Name: AMY
Text: Thank you, sir. But, as important as your praise is to me, it should actually go to Gina. She's the one that got through to the kids.

Name: GINA
Text: Yes, I am amazing. And I only ask for one thing in repayment. A 600% raise.

Name: HOLT
Text: Or... I can give you a zero percent raise and make you my personal assistant, which is what I'm doing. I think you have hidden talents, which will make you surprisingly good at the job.

Name: GINA
Text: No, I have no talents.

Name: HOLT
Text: You start Monday.

Name: GINA
Text: Ugh. Constantly getting Holt's approval is the worst.

Name: AMY
Text: Yes, I can only imagine.

Name: JAKE
Text: Well, the curse is over. The slump is done. Jake is back. Permission to take a selfie of the two of us, sir? [holds out phone in front of both their faces]

Name: HOLT
Text: Permission denied.

Name: JAKE
Text: Too late. Ah, that was a good one.

Name: HOLT
Text: So, the rabbit's foot worked, huh?

Name: JAKE
Text: Ah, maybe. All I know is my mind was so numb from doing all that boring data entry that my brain kind of rebooted, and I had an inspiration about one of my old cases. [deep breath] And I now see that that was your plan all along. And that you're capable of smiling.

Name: HOLT
Text: All talented detectives haves their ups and downs, Peralta.

Name: JAKE
Text: So you think I'm talented. You said it. No takebacks.

Name: HOLT
Text: You know why Boyle doesn't slump?

Name: JAKE
Text: Because his whole life is a slump?

Name: HOLT
Text: Because he doesn't let adversity get him down. He keeps grinding. If I'd given you those new cases, the second you hit a snag, you would have spiraled again. You need to stay out of your own head.

Name: JAKE
Text: Okay. But, sir, I don't get it. If that was your plan, why bother with Smitty and the rabbit's foot?

Name: HOLT
Text: Well, there's a very good reason for that. I was, uh, I believe the term is, uh... messing with you.

Name: JAKE
Text: Oh... I see what's going on here. We're becoming homies. Office Christmas card candidate, right here! Me and Holt are homies!

Name: CHARLES
Text: Hey, Sarge. I assembled the castle for you. Here it is.

Name: TERRY
Text: Oh, my god. What happened to all the princess flourishes?

Name: CHARLES
Text: Well, they were destroyed, so I turned it into a princess police station. You know, some jobs take brains, some jobs take muscles, some jobs take dainty little fingers. Did I ever tell you I had to wear a woman's wedding ring?

Name: TERRY
Text: Thank you, Boyle. I appreciate it.

Name: CHARLES
Text: You're a good dad. Don't put so much pressure on yourself. Oh, check this out. Working siren. [flicks a switch and a siren starts blaring] I'll fix that!

Name: AMY
Text: I'm so glad we could finally do this.

Name: DATE
Text: I know, Kylie says you're always stuck at the precinct.

Name: AMY
Text: Yeah. Speaking of, this is work. Sorry. What's up, Peralta?

Name: JAKE
Text: Captain called. He needs everybody back. There's a lead on the nightingale strangler.

Name: AMY
Text: Okay.

Name: JAKE
Text: His M.O. is he finds lonely women with no friends, poisons their food, and then guts 'em in his van. It's pretty gnarly. Last seen wearing a salmon shirt, grey blazer, and witnesses have said he has trouble fitting lettuce in his mouth.

Name: AMY
Text: Okay. Where are you?

Name: JAKE
Text: Apparently has the world's smallest pen1s and doesn't know how to use it... Hi, there, I'm Jake Peralta, Amy's boss. That's not true.

Name: AMY
Text: What are you doing here?

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm here on a date. Who is now leaving. Worth it. Have a great night.

Name: DATE
Text: Your boss seems really nice.

Name: AMY
Text: He's not my boss.

Name: JAKE
Text: Yes, I am!

Name: JAKE
Text: And with a record five felonies solved in one week, Peralta pulls ahead. Did you guys hear that I solved five felonies in a week?

Text: Five felonies in one week! Light 'em up, Boyle.

Text: That's the sweet taste of triumph.

Text: Yep.

Text: Updates on open cases.

Text: You're the primary, you're in charge. Take Diaz and Peralta.

Name: BOYLE
Text: Yes. My fantasy threesome. Of cops on a case.

Text: Detectives, our monthly crime statistics are due. I want all paperwork on your closed cases by tomorrow. Scully, you can just write "I didn't close any" on a piece of paper.

Name: SCULLY
Text: You got it.

Text: Then I guess this little reminder isn't for you.

Text: Wow, looks like he hates you even more than me.

Text: No, he doesn't. We have a good relationship. We're on the same page.

Name: AMY
Text: No, sir, I wasn't... Peralta was the one that was talking. God, you must have been the worst fourth grader ever.

Text: Joke's on you. I skipped fourth grade.

Text: Santiago, anything else?

Name: SANTIAGO
Text: No.

Name: HOLT
Text: No?

Name: AMY
Text: Uh-uh.

Text: Dismissed.

Text: Hey, Boyle. I know you haven't had Peralta as a secondary in a while. Be careful. It can be rough.

Name: JAKE
Text: Hey, saboteur, that's not true.

Name: JAKE
Text: I happen to be a very good secondary.

Name: AMY
Text: So you were just borrowing those cars?

Name: PERALTA
Text: Ask about his bank account. Ask about his bank account! Ask him about his bank...

Name: AMY
Text: You can't give up control, you're terrible at taking your primary's orders, you just do whatever you want. I could go on and on and on.

Name: JAKE
Text: Is something no lover of yours has ever said.

Text: Blammo.

Text: Okay, don't ever call me that again. I'm driving. We should leave now. Carry my bag. But you should pick the music, primary.

Text: Me too. So I have an eyewitness in the purse-snatcher case. Only problem is, the sketch artist is out sick. How do you want me to proceed?

Text: No. This is how I walk.

Name: ROSA
Text: What are you thinking, Boyle?

Name: CHARLES
Text: All ri...

Name: JAKE
Text: I'm calling natural causes. We got heart medicine over here, home defibrillator. And a frequent customer gift basket from the cardiac wing of Brooklyn Methodist. This case is open and shut. Just like his mouth was, constantly. That was my last fat joke. Okay? Diaz, check and see if there's any more meds in the bathroom. Boyle, see what you can find in the bedroom. I'll take the kitchen.

Name: CHARLES
Text: Yep, that's exactly what I was gonna say. It's... it's so weird. He's so good at knowing what I'm gonna tell him to do, he just does it. It's weird.

Text: Hey, sergeant. You know how you're really good at doodling?

Text: I know you think you're complimenting me, but calling them doodles is an insult. You a big fan of Picasso's doodles?

Name: JAKE

Name: AMY
Text: I'm telling you, he and I have a connection and there is something bothering him. Can you help me out?
